channel.title: Comments on: Let Black Characters Be the Lead
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Kayla
item.dc:creator: Kayla
item.description: In addition to cartoon friend groups with only one black friend for "diversity points", I feel like it was (and still is) also common for shows/movies with Black leads to have a white best friend to not "alienate" a white audience, like Lottie from Princess and the Frog and Chelsea from That's So Raven. It's like they expect white viewers would be unwilling to watch these shows unless there was someone to represent us. And yet shows/movies with an all-white cast are expected to have a universal appeal...? Sigh. But thank you for reminding me how great Proud Family was! And I hope we can expect more animation like Hair Love in the (not so far) future. ?
